result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph J Meng was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.name: Rusk Co. District Attorney
superAgency.notes: DE must comply with all conditions set forth in Agreement for Deferred Acceptance of Plea, should DE be successful charge shall be dismissed.

supervisions.notes: May be served with Huber privilege.

The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores.

No violent, abusive or threatening behavior.

Reinstating Bond.  (filed in 15CF86)

DEFENDANT IS NOT TO CONSUME OR POSSESS ALCOHOL.  DO NOT ENTER PREMISES WHERE ALCOHOL IS PRIMARY BUSINESS, ANY BARS TAVERNS OR LIQUOR STORES.  WILL DO DAILY PBT'S AT THE DIRECTION OF THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT.  DE will be in jail outside of working hours.  DE will be subject to all huber rules/body search upon return each day, DE will pay huber fees.

Atty Nussberger's motion to reinstate  bond.  Court recites motion filed by Atty Nussberger.  State opposes reinstatement of  bond and states reasons.  Atty Nussberger addresses the court as to the motion filed and the conditions DE would abide by.  The court will reinstate  bond with the conditions that DE will be in jail outside of working hours, DE will be subject to same body search rules as huber inmates upon return each day,  DE will pay huber fees.  Any other previous bond conditions will remain.

Defendant Joseph J Meng in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF90, 14CF100, 15CF115, 15CF53, 15CT21, along with uncharges case.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  Court satisfied will accept waiver.  DE will enter plea's to the following cases.  
14CF74-Ct 1, NC plea, court will note but hold in abeyance for a two year period.  Must complete all conditions laid out in the DAGP. Bond continues
14CF90-Ct 2, NC plea, court will accept and find the DE guilty.
14CF100-Ct 1, NC plea, Court will accept and find the DE guilty.  
14CF115-Ct 1, NC plea, court will note but hold in abeyance for a two year period.  Must complete all conditions laid out in the DAGP. Bond continues

15CT21, 15CF53, uncharged case and additional counts in above case will be DRI.  
Mr Meng addresses the court.  The court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Will withhold sentence, 2 years probation, will serve 15 days jail on each count, consecutive, pay CC in both cases.  Will maintain sobriety, no bars, taverns or liquor stores,  jail will be served at the discretion of the DOC officer.  Court costs will be taken from the bond posted.  Any additional will be returned to poster.  DE's truck will be released to his father.  Will report to probation today.
